DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Physician-initiated smoking cessation strategy may effective get early-stage cancer patient quit smoke . PURPOSE : Randomized clinical trial compare effectiveness physician-initiated stop-smoking program usual care patient receive treatment early-stage cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Physician-Initiated Stop-Smoking Program Patients Receiving Treatment Early-Stage Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Compare efficacy brief physician-initiated smoking cessation strategy vs usual care patient early stage cancer undergo treatment clinical oncology setting . - Compare sociodemographic , smoke history , health status correlate smoke cessation patient treat regimen . - Determine feasibility conduct cancer prevention control study cooperative group set monitor adherence smoking-cessation strategy . OUTLINE : This randomize , multicenter study . Patients stratify accord center . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive usual care ( special intervention ) . - Arm II : Patients receive smoking-cessation therapy base 4-step intervention plan `` Manual Physicians '' publish National Cancer Institute . The smoking cessation coordinator physician provide self-quitting advice support patient via counseling , self-help material , referral smoking cessation counselor Cancer Information Service ( CIS ) . Patients receive nicotine replacement , indicate . Patients express interest intensive treatment refer local American Cancer Society American Lung Association clinic and/or advise call CIS additional local program referral . All patient follow 6 12 month . Patients report still smoke interested help quit smoke 12-month follow-up interview encourage return physician contact CIS additional help quit referral intensive specialize treatment area . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 494 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : One follow diagnosis : Stage I II bladder , colorectal , head neck , lung , cancer Stage IIII testicular cancer Stage IIV breast cancer , prostate cancer , lymphoma Must smoke 1 cigarette within past month define self smoker Hormone receptor status : Not specify PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 19 Sex : Not specify Menopausal status : Not specify Performance status : ECOG 01 Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Cardiovascular : No history recent heart attack Other : Not pregnant No imminent medical need require referral intensive smoking cessation regimen PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : Not specify Endocrine therapy : Not specify Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : Not specify Other : No prior participation pilot phase study
